result:
List of active United States Air Force aircraft squadrons

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Jump to: navigation, search

This is an organized incomplete list of all of the active aircraft squadrons that currently exist in the United States Air Force, sorted by type. Most squadrons have changed names and designations many times over the years, so they are listed by their current designation.

To see all USAF squadrons, regardless of active or not, go to the List of United States Air Force squadrons.

Contents

  • 1 Aggressor Squadrons
  • 2 Airborne Air Control Squadrons
  • 3 Airborne Command and Control Squadron
  • 4 Airlift Squadrons

  • 6 Fighter Squadrons
  • 7 Flight Test Squadrons
  • 8 Reconnaissance Squadrons

  • 11 Test and Evaluation Squadrons
  • 12 Weapons Squadrons
  • 13 See also
  • 14 References

Aggressor Squadrons[edit]

Aggressor Squadrons' sole purpose is to train and evaluate United States Air Force fighter pilots who have either just received their fighter pilot status or those who want a refresher. They fly USAF aircraft with a different paint-scheme and act as "adversary" aircraft that student pilots must "shoot down."

Squadron Name Insignia Nickname Command Air Force Wing Primary Markings Date Commissioned Base Aircraft Tail Code
18th Aggressor Squadron Blue Foxes Pacific Air Forces Eleventh Air Force 354th FW 1939 Eielson AFB, Alaska F-16C/D AK
64th Aggressor Squadron Air Combat Command 57th WG 1940 Nellis AFB, Nevada F-16C WA
